meanings.sent1: She defamiliarized her routine by taking a new route to work.
meanings.sent2: The artist defamiliarized everyday objects in his abstract paintings.
meanings.sent3: The magician defamiliarized the audience by making a rabbit disappear and reappear.
meanings.sent4: The writer defamiliarized the concept of time in her science fiction novel.
meanings.sent5: The photographer defamiliarized the landscape by capturing it from a unique angle.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel unfamiliar or strange.
meanings.sent1: The eerie music defamiliarized the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent2: The new environment defamiliarized him, making him feel out of place.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist in the movie defamiliarized the audience, leaving them in suspense.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather defamiliarized the usual sunny days.
meanings.sent5: The unusual behavior of the cat defamiliarized the owner, who was used to its calm demeanor.
